Trevor Brown is an Australian musician, composer, improviser, sound designer, lecturer and radio presenter whose diverse career has spanned from symphony orchestra to outback circus to festival director.

His work crosses  between classical, jazz, improvised, new music, sound design and electronic music with deep roots in and reseatrch in traditional musics from around the world.

He has performed, produced and composed works for  the Sydney Opera House, MONA and DARK MOFO, headlined at Woodford Festival, performed at Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide, Perth and Darwin Festivals.

In Europe, tours regularly as a soloist and various projects in UK, Italy, Germany, Austria and Croatia. He has been featured artist at Ars Electronica, Porec Jazz Festival, and many other festivals in Italy, Croatia, Slovenia.

He worked with the London, Vienna, and Berlin Improvisers Orchestras, and is the artistic director of  the Sydney Improvisers Composers Kollektiv Orchestra, the only orchestra of it’s kind in Australia.

Trevor is currently the Artist in Residence for for the Whites Creek Cottage for 2022, offered by the Inner-West Council.
